Guanosine 3',5'-cyclic monophosphate.Definition: A nucleotide synthesized by the enzyme guanylyl cyclase. This nucleotide acts to modify proteins in two ways. By binding directly to proteins such as cGMP-sensitive cation channels in the retina, and by protein phosphorylation through the cGMP-dependent protein kinase.
